page.title: 03Cosham House
page.content: One of the important large houses is Cosham House which stands on the corner of Burrill Avenue and Havant Road. The present house probably dates to the 18th Century though it is believed to have replaced a previous one on the same site. The are some flint outhouses and boundary walls. There are more than twenty rooms including a large 40 feet long lounge with bay windows looking onto lawns. There is an interesting railway style verandah. There are some original kitchen paving slabs and a cool cellar which is now used to store wine but would have been used meat and general provisions. There is an acre of ground which includes some rare and listed trees.
